Question: This person (born Nathaniel Hathorne; July 4, 1804 – May 19, 1864) was an American novelist and short story writer.
Hints: This person's father, Nathaniel Hathorne, Sr., was a sea captain who died in 1808 of yellow fever in Suriname.
This person had a particularly close relationship with his publishers William Ticknor and James Thomas Fields.
While on a tour of the White Mountains, this person died in his sleep on May 19, 1864, in Plymouth, New Hampshire.
